column10: Housing subsidy in Barking and Dagenham
column12:
Summary Agenda

9.30 am
   
Prayers.
Afterwards
   
Private Members’ Bills: Second Readings.
     
(Note: If proceedings on the first Bill end before 2.30 pm, the fifth Bill and, possibly, subsequent Bills may be debated in the time remaining. After 2.30 pm, only those Bills which are unopposed may make further progress.)
At the end of the sitting
   
Adjournment : Housing subsidy in Barking and Dagenham (Jon Cruddas) (until 3.00 pm or for half an hour, whichever is later).

Summary Agenda

2.30 pm
   
Prayers.
Afterwards
   
Oral Questions to the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions, including at 3.15 pm Topical Questions.
3.30 pm
   
Urgent Questions, Ministerial Statements, including on Building Britain’s Future.
Afterwards
   
Parliamentary Standards Bill: Second Reading (may continue until 10.00 pm).
     
—followed by Programme Motion (without separate debate).
     
—followed by Money Resolution (without separate debate).
     
Statutory Instruments (Motions for approval) (without debate).
     
Legislative Reform Order (Motion for approval) (without debate).
     
Motions to change the membership of Select Committees: Children, Schools and Families; Regulatory Reform; Work and Pensions (no debate after 10.00 pm).
At the end of the sitting
   
Adjournment Debate: Asbestos in homes (Mr Michael Clapham) (until 10.30 pm or for half an hour, whichever is later).

Summary Agenda

10.30 am
   
Prayers.
Afterwards
   
Private Business (without debate).
     
Oral Questions to Mr Chancellor of the Exchequer, including at 11.15 am Topical Questions.
11.30 am
   
Urgent Questions (if any); Business Question to
the Leader of the House; Ministerial Statements
(if any).
Afterwards
   
Defence in the UK (Motion) (may continue until 6.00 pm).
At the end of the sitting
   
Adjournment Debate: Future of public houses
(Mr Laurence Robertson) (until 6.30 pm or for half an hour, whichever is later).

Summary Agenda

10.30 am
   
Prayers.
Afterwards
   
Oral Questions to the Minister of State for Transport, including at 11.05 am Topical Questions.
11.15 am
   
Oral Questions to the Minister for Women and Equality.
11.30 am
   
Urgent Questions (if any); Business Question to the Leader of the House; Ministerial Statements (if any).
Afterwards
   
Presentation of Bill (without debate).
     
Business of the House (Motion) (may continue until 6.00 pm).
     
Regional Select Committee (London) (Motion) (may continue for up to one hour, if the Business of the House Motion is agreed to).
     
Standing Orders Etc. (Machinery of Government Changes); Parliamentary Pensions (Motions) (may continue until 5.00 pm, if the Business of the House Motion is agreed to).
     
Regional Grand Committees (Motions) (without debate).
At the end of the sitting
   
Adjournment Debate: Preservation of traditional crafts (Tom Levitt) (until 6.30 pm or for half an hour, whichever is later).

Summary Agenda

2.30 pm
   
Prayers.
Afterwards
   
Urgent Questions, Ministerial Statements (if any).
     
Business of the House (Motion) (may continue until 10.00 pm).
     
Speaker’s Committee on the Search of Offices on the Parliamentary Estate (Motion) (may continue for three hours after the commencement of proceedings on the Business of the House Motion, if that Motion is agreed to).
     
Queen’s Speech (Motion for an Address) (proposed subjects for debate: Employment, Universities and Skills and Housing) (may continue until 11.00 pm, if the 10.00 pm Business Motion is agreed to).
     
Estimates (Motion) (without debate).
At the end of the sitting
   
Adjournment Debate: Consultations on Post Office closures (Dr Richard Taylor) (until 10.30 pm or for half an hour, whichever is later).

Summary Agenda

11.30 am
   
Prayers.
Afterwards
   
Oral Questions to the Secretary of State for Scotland.
12 noon

12.30 pm
   
Urgent Questions, Ministerial Statements (if any).
Afterwards
   
Queen’s Speech (Motion for an Address) (proposed subjects for debate: Foreign Affairs and Defence) (may continue until 7.00 pm).
     
Business of the House (Consolidated Fund Bill) (Motion) (no debate after 7.00 pm).
At the end of the sitting
   
Adjournment Debate: River Hull and River Humber flood risk management strategy (Mr Graham Stuart) (until 7.30 pm or for half an hour, whichever is later).
